sen.j: 一条（いちじょう）家は、摂家のひとつで公家である。
sen.e: The house of Ichijo is one of the Sekke (Regent) House and a kuge, court noble.

sen.j: 藤原氏藤原北家摂関家九条流で、鎌倉時代の公卿である、九条道家三男一条実経を祖とし、道家が創建した一条殿を実経が受け継いで住んだ事が家名の由来。
sen.e: Kujo Line of Sekkan (regent and senior regent) House, the House of Fujiwara North; a kugyo, court noble, in the Kamakura period; the original forefather is Sanetsune ICHIJO, the third son of Michiie KUJO; the name of the House comes from the fact that Sanetsune inherited Ichijo Hall that was built by Michiie to live in.

The Kujo line of sekkan (regent and senior regent) houses, the House of Fujiwara North; a kugyo (court noble) during the Kamakura period; the original forefather was Sanetsune ICHIJO, the third son of Michiie KUJO; the name of the house comes from the fact that Sanetsune inherited Ichijo Hall, which had been built by Michiie to live in.

The Kujo line of sekkan (regent and senior regent) houses, the House of Fujiwara North of the Fujiwara clan, was a kugyo (court noble) during the Kamakura period; the original forefather was Sanetsune ICHIJO, the third son of Michiie KUJO; the name of the house was due to the fact that Sanetsune had inherited Ichijo Hall, which had been built by Michiie as a residence.
sen.cmt: the Fujiwara clanを追加しました。

sen.j: 序列は近衛家に次ぎ、九条家、二条家、鷹司家と同格扱いであった（なお、九条家とは南北朝時代_(日本)に嫡流を巡って相論となったが、後光厳天皇によりいずれも嫡流であるとの綸旨が下された。詳細は九条家の項目を参照のこと）。
sen.e: As for the ranking, the House of Ichijo was inferior to Konoe Family and equal to Kujo Family, Nijo Family, and Takatsukasa Family (The House of Ichijo was opposed to Kujo Family over the legitimate blood of the family in the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan), and Emperor Go-Kogen gave the imperial order that both of the family lines should be the legitimate blood of the family. For the details, see the item of Kujo Family.)

For details, see the item on the Kujo Family.)

For details, see the item on the Kujo Family).
sen.cmt: 南北朝を the period of the Northern and Southern Courts (Japan) としました。"the" を挿入しました。"House of～" -> "～Family" に変更しました。

sen.j: 江戸時代の家禄は初め1000石、後に1500石へ加増、幕末は2044石。
sen.e: Stipend in the Edo period was 1000 koku at the beginning, raised to 1500 koku later, and 2044 koku at the end of the Edo Shogunate period.

sen.j: 室町時代の一条兼良は、政治以外に、学問や連歌の文化的活躍も残した。
sen.e: Kanera ICHIJO in the Muromachi period was active not only in the politics but also in the cultural world such as academics and renga, linked verse.

sen.e: In the Sengoku period; the Warring States period (Japan), Norifusa ICHIJO moved down to Tosa that was his fief, and the branch family became a Sengoku-daimyo, Tosa-Ichijo family.
